title: Fridge, bed removed from home of Bella Bond's mother
content:
State police investigators returned to the home of Bella Bond's mother Wednesday and were seen removing evidence from the Dorchester home. 
 
Detectives were seen removing a refrigerator and mattress from Rachelle Bond's home.   

Bella Bond's body was found in a plastic bag on a beach on Deer Island by a woman walking her dog. She was known for nearly three months as Baby Doe as investigators worked to learn her identity. 

Her mother, Rachelle Bond, 40, is charged with being an accessory after the fact to Bella's death. Bond's boyfriend, Michael McCarthy, 35, is charged with murder for allegedly punching the girl in the abdomen until she stopped breathing. 

Bella's body was then kept in a refrigerator for some time before being placed on Deer Island. 

DCF said the agency had been involved with the girl twice when she was an infant - in 2012 and 2013 - providing neglect-related support. The cases were then closed.
